Text.val: Create the records that will be displayed.

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}{\f1\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset0 Courier New;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 A Choice control often gets it\rquote s options from the data. For instance, the control may get the options from the Range property of a virtual, or it may link live to a table. However, for Combo boxes and List boxes, you also have the option of adding additional values to the list, in addition to the values that come from the Range or Data source table.\par \par This is accomplished by simply adding the additional values to the Items List and Display List properties for the control. The values added there will be displayed above the items from the Data Source.\par \par In this example, the values \cf2 All\cf1 and \cf2 None\cf1 are added to the combo box. None will display when no item is selected yet, because the corresponding Item list item is blank (a backslash):\par \par \f1\fs24 Items list: \cf2\\,ALL\cf1\par Display list: \cf2 None,All\cf1\f0\fs20\par }

ExpSyntax.val: 'HG22:How Do I Combine Additional Options With a Data Bound Choice Control?'
